title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 23
author: Various
snippet: I have seen him, when in company withKincaldrum, and Dudhope, and Gleneagles, and the rest, laughing till hisface was as red as the sun, then, all of a sudden, when some of hismoods came over him, turn just like a fiend new come out of--oh, I'lljust say it out, Aminadab, though ye be of the Seceders--just hell,lad."
